title: CO- by US Chamber of Commerce

items.title: How Fashionphile Founder Grew Her Humble eBay Shop Into a Multimillion-Dollar Resale Juggernaut
SBA Disaster Assistance Loans Guide: Types, Terms, and Eligibility
items.summary:
- Types and eligibility: Business Physical Disaster Loans, Economic Injury Disaster Loans (EIDLs), Military Reservist EIDLs (MREIDLs), and Home/Real Property Loans; agricultural enterprises are not eligible.
- Terms/cost: up to $2M for business losses; real property up to $500k, personal property up to $100k; rates up to 4% (8% if credit unavailable); 30-year terms; Express Bridge up to $25k; processing weeks–months.
- Apply/prepare: via MySBA portal or Disaster Recovery Centers; required docs include SBA Form 413, SBA Form 2202, IRS Form 4506-C; all loans require a personal guarantee; keep organized records.

items.title: Sales Strategies to Embrace this Year
items.summary:
- Hybrid/omnichannel selling blends digital and offline outreach, tightens marketing and sales collaboration, and uses combined customer insights.
- AI agents and genAI offer efficiency but demand disciplined, trust-based use and clear buyer value to prevent losses.
- Data-driven processes with KPI tracking and leadership alignment help translate insights into actions and resilience.

items.title: How to Choose Between a Sole Proprietorship and an LLC
items.summary:
- Sole proprietorships are easy to start with no liability protection, but they leave personal assets exposed and can hinder business credit; they use pass-through taxation via Schedule C.
- LLCs provide liability protection, credibility, and flexible management; they are more complex and costly to set up, but can still be taxed as pass-through or elected as a corporation.
- When choosing, weigh liability, taxes, setup effort, and credit access; switching from a sole proprietorship to an LLC requires state filings, EIN, permits, and possibly a signed operating agreement.

items.title: What Are FIFO and LIFO?
items.summary:
- FIFO (first in, first out) uses oldest costs for COGS and is the most common method; it’s generally more accurate for perishable goods. LIFO (last in, first out) uses newer costs for COGS, can reduce taxable income in inflation and improve cash flow, but may understate ending inventory; LIFO is allowed under US GAAP but not IFRS.
- The article provides a COGS example showing that in inflationary conditions FIFO yields lower COGS and higher gross profit than LIFO (e.g., COGS 1200 vs 1600; gross profit 1800 vs 1400), which can raise taxes.
- Switching inventory costing methods is possible with IRS Form 3115; a single method must be adopted in the first tax year, changes are discouraged and must be well documented, and professional advice is advised.

items.title: Targeting Him: How Men Became the Next Frontier in Beauty Brand Expansion
items.summary:
- The global men's grooming market is expanding toward $276B by 2030 (8% CAGR), with brands moving beyond shaving into skincare, hair, fragrance and even nail care.
- Campaigns and retail plays—AMP/Target Tone, Suave Stress Relief and Barber Essentials—plus storytelling and education drive access and younger, wellness-minded male shoppers.
- Fragrance, makeup and nail trends are rising; celebrities and viral chatter accelerate interest, and roughly half of U.S. men already use skincare.

items.title: Are Hashtags Still Relevant? Here’s How to Use Them
items.summary:
- Hashtags still matter in 2025, but effectiveness hinges on quality and relevance, not quantity.
- Follow platform rules: 2 per post on X, 3–5 on Instagram, 2–3 on LinkedIn, minimum 3 on TikTok; tailor per network.
- The piece also contains advertorial content promoting the U.S. Chamber, crypto payments, and a newsletter.

items.title: What Are OKRs and Why Do You Need Them?
items.summary: - OKRs = Objective plus 2–5 measurable Key Results; align teams and tie to quarterly planning; origin: Intel via Grove, Doerr at Google. - Implement: publish OKRs, track progress, use templates/tools, regular check-ins; avoid mixing KPIs with KR or rigid objectives. - Benefits: clarity, focus, engagement; use FACTS (Focus, Alignment, Commitment, Tracking, Stretch); seek professional guidance for tailored help.

items.title: Invoice Factoring vs. Invoice Financing: What's the Difference?
items.summary:
- Factoring sells unpaid invoices to a factor who then collects payments, delivering cash quickly (about 24–48 hours after invoice verification).
- AR financing borrows against invoices while you continue to bill and collect; funding is usually slower to arrange but draws can be same or next day after approval, with standard interest-style costs and possible extra fees.
- Qualification and customer impact differ: factoring is easier and relies on customer credit but may impose a blanket lien and notice of assignment; financing involves lender evaluation and potential liens or guarantees, while you maintain customer communications.

items.title: Beauty Brands Well-Positioned for Growth as Consumers Tighten Their Belts
items.summary:
- Value-seeking consumers drive growth in accessible, high-quality beauty as mass-market gains outpace prestige, signaling mass–premium convergence; brands like Suave, Fine’ry and Slatkin + Co leverage refreshed formulas, packaging, and distribution.
- ScentWorx candles at Walmart and CVS embody luxury-for-all, offering premium home fragrances at low cost; Slatkin emphasizes high style with US-made products and a fading mass–premium gap.
- Storytelling and packaging upgrades fuel cross-shopping across price tiers and channels, helping target new demographics amid tariff-driven price pressures and macro uncertainty.

items.title: Practical AI Strategies for Small Businesses
How Trove Is Making Resale Work For Brands
items.summary:
- AI-driven, brand-owned resale on brands’ sites for resale, returns, repairs and trade-ins; originated as Yerdle in 2012, rebranded 2016.
- Monetizes reverse logistics, tightens control of the secondary market, and draws new customers; 50%–80% of resale shoppers are new to a brand, ~50% buy full-price within 6 months.
- Resale market growth is strong: US online resale up 400% since 2020; secondhand apparel could reach $367B by 2029; Trove expanded in Europe (reverse.supply) and launched Re-Calvin with Calvin Klein.

items.title: How Small Brands Are Winning With Reddit, AI, and B2B Sales
items.summary:
- Reddit for business, AI democratization, and B2B pivots of B2C brands - examples include Tree Amigos' local authority gains, Curious Elixirs' restaurant/distributor expansion, and Ergatta's Peloton/NordicTrack partnerships.
- Reddit strategy focuses on non-promotional content; share genuinely helpful insights to build trust and improve search visibility.
- AI speeds up R&D, marketing, and trend analysis; AI-powered try-ons and shade matchers aid product selection and free time for human interactions and in-store experiences.

items.title: How Small Businesses Can Prepare for 2026 Economic Trends and Policies
items.summary:
- Stay informed and engage with policymakers and groups like the U.S. Chamber; support measures to reduce regulatory burdens on small businesses.
- Position CO as a source of expert insight and inspiration, cautioning readers to consult professionals before decisions.
- Consider subscribing to Midnight Oil for expert advice, news, and trends; privacy policy and opt-out apply.

items.title: Business Continuity: Small Business Planning and Considerations
What Is a Digital Nomad?
items.summary:
- Digital nomads are location-independent workers who rely on the internet to work while traveling; demographics show rapid growth.
- Visa, tax, and health considerations are central; 60+ countries offer DN visas with varying fees and renewals, plus U.S. tax rules to consider.
- Getting started involves building a location-independent income, planning finances and logistics, and adopting cybersecurity and productivity practices for travel.

items.title: How to Find and Hire Top Talent for Your Small Business
How to Plan for Retirement as an Entrepreneur
items.summary:
- Don’t rely on employer plans; craft an intentional, flexible retirement strategy tied to your business revenue with early targets (15–25% pre‑tax, 20–30% if late).
- Choose self-employed accounts (Traditional IRA, Roth IRA, SEP IRA, Solo 401(k)); plan for irregular income with budgeting, cushion savings, automated contributions, and quarterly reviews.
- Diversify beyond the business, plan for exit milestones, compare retirement accounts vs brokerage for tax benefits and flexibility, and seek professional guidance.

items.title: How SMBs Use Ring to Enhance Security and Streamline Operations
items.summary:
- Ring enables centralized, multi-location security with delegated access for branch managers and dock monitoring via dockmaster, driving operational visibility across sites.
- Features include 24/7 recording, up to 180 days cloud storage, real-time alerts, and Virtual Security Guard that deter intrusions and speed investigations.
- Flexible pricing with no long-term contracts, encrypted video, DIY or professional installation, and a single dashboard to manage security and operations from anywhere.

items.title: Marketers Court Black Friday Shoppers With Emotion-Fueled Gifting Experiences That Glimpse 2026 Trends
items.summary:
- Marketers tie 2025 holiday campaigns to limited-edition drops, activations and cultural moments (e.g., Stranger Things) to build community amid uncertainty.
- Nostalgia-driven partnerships like Anthropologie x NYC Ballet Nutcracker line show how festive decor and theater-tinged offerings cue emotion beyond products.
- The NFL broadens branding to deepen fan communities with watch parties and merch, while cultural capital is framed as a currency guiding decisions and anchoring experiences.
